title: Sun Jihai inducted into Manchester City's Hall of Fame
text:
Sun Jihai inducted into Manchester City's Hall of Fame 
CCTV.com Font size: Sun was widely considered one of the best Chinese defenders in the 1990s and early 2000s. 
President Xi got a first hand look as the English Premier League's first Chinese player -- Sun Jihai -- was inducted into Manchester City's Hall of Fame. The 38-year-old was a main stay at the club for six years.Sun was the first Asian player to sign with the team. He was last month named as Man City's Ambassador to China. Sun was widely considered one of the best Chinese defenders in the 1990s and early 2000s. 
Winning 4 domestic league titles from 1996 to 2001, he was transferred to Man City in 2002, and voted the best for player for the club in September of that year. 
In October of 2002, Sun became the first Chinese player to score in the Premier League, when he headed home the first goal in a 2-nil win over Birmingham, and he believes Xi's visit can benefit soccer in this country. Related Videos
